title: President Dissanayake to address World Governments Summit 2025 today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to address the World Governments Summit 2025 held in Dubai today (12).

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that a few showers may occur in Batticaloa, Ampara, Matale, Badulla and Polonnaruwa districts today (12).

title: President AKD holds talks with Pakistani PM in Dubai
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with Pakistan’s Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Tuesday evening (11) in Dubai.

title: Exporters seek tax relief and cost reductions in 2025 Budget
byline: The National Chamber of Exporters (NCE) is calling for relief measures in the upcoming 2025 Budget to help businesses recover from years of economic challenges.

title: Sri Lanka’s top tea pluckers honoured with gold coins
byline: In a ceremony held at the Mahanilu Tea Factory in Samimale, 18 of the best green tea pluckers from five tea estates under the Horana Plantation Company were honored with 22-carat gold coins and certificates in recognition of their exceptional contribution to the tea industry.

title: Israel says Gaza ceasefire will end if Hamas does not free hostages by Saturday
byline: Israel’s prime minister has warned Hamas it will end the ceasefire in Gaza and resume intense fighting if the Palestinian group “does not return our hostages by Saturday noon [10:00 GMT]”.

title: Australia’s Matthew Kuhnemann reported for suspect bowling action
byline: Australia spinner Matthew Kuhnemann has been reported for suspect bowling action after the second Test against Sri Lanka in Galle.

title: No possibility of tax reduction this year - Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Industries and Entrepreneurship Chathuranga Abeysinghe states that there is no possibility of reducing taxes within this year, as the government is required to collect 15.1% of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in taxes in accordance with agreements reached with the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

title: ‘Gulf of America’ arrives on Google Maps
byline: The body of water formerly known in the United States as the Gulf of Mexico is now listed for US-based users of Google Maps as the Gulf of America.

title: Two hospitalized following alleged assault by MP Archchuna
byline: Two individuals who were allegedly assaulted by Jaffna District Parliamentarian Dr. Ramanathan Archchuna have been hospitalized on Tuesday (11).

title: No political reasons behind recent OIC transfers, but inefficiency
byline: Sri Lanka Police state that none of the recent Officer-in-Charge (OIC) transfers took place due to political reasons.

title: CEB’s decision on power interruptions expected tomorrow
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) says that a statement will be made regarding any further power interruptions tomorrow morning (13).

title: Public warned of fake job scams misusing CBSL logo
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has issued a warning regarding a rise in fraudulent job advertisements falsely claiming to offer employment opportunities at the CBSL.

title: Probe launched after suspect released on police bail dies in Wadduwa
byline: The office of the Superintendent of Police in Panadura has initiated an investigation following a complaint that a father-of-one, who was arrested by Wadduwa Police, died after vomiting blood at home following his release on police bail.

title: MP Archchuna accused of attacking man with plate; Victim undergoes surgery
byline: A person who sustained head injuries after allegedly being attacked with a plate by Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna, during an altercation at a hotel in Jaffna last night (11), has been referred for surgery at the Jaffna Teaching Hospital, the hospital director confirmed.

title: President Dissanayake meets Kuwaiti PM, strengthen trade and investment ties
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is on an official visit to the UAE, has met with the Prime Minister of the State of Kuwait, Sheikh Ahmad Abdullah Al Ahmad Al Sabah.

title: Ferry service between India, Sri Lanka may restart in February
byline: Climate change-induced gale-force winds, erratic monsoons, and a turbulent sea are now hindering the smooth operation of the India-Sri Lanka ferry service, which was resumed with much fanfare 17 months ago.

title: One Direction rejects Brit Awards 2025 reunion offer to honour Liam Payne
byline: One Direction has rejected an offer to reunite at the Brit Awards to honour their late bandmate Liam Payne.

title: CCTV footage shows MP Archchuna assaulting person at Jaffna hotel
byline: CCTV camera footage has surfaced showing Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna assaulting an individual at a hotel in Jaffna.

title: Greece elects former parliament speaker as new president
byline: Greece’s parliament elected its former speaker, Constantine Tassoulas, as the country’s president on Wednesday, approving the conservative government’s nominee for the largely ceremonial role.

title: Amarapura Nikaya Mahanayaka’s credentials ceremony set for March 10
byline: A discussion was held at the Presidential Secretariat, under the patronage of Secretary to the President Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake regarding the organization of the presentation of the credentials for the position of Most Venerable Mahanayaka of the Amarapura Maha Nikaya of Sri Lanka under the state patronage.

title: 4 cops arrested for assaulting suspect who died after release on police bail in Wadduwa
byline: Four police constables attached to the Wadduwa Police Station have been arrested this afternoon (12) for allegedly assaulting a person who had been apprehended and later died after vomiting blood at home, following his release on police bail.

title: CAA seize 3,000 bags of rice hoarded in Pettah
byline: Officials of the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) have today seized a stock of rice that was hoarded and prepared for sale at a higher price.

title: President Dissanayake addresses World Governments Summit
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has addressed the main session of the 2025 World Governments Summit in Dubai, where he outlined Sri Lanka’s vision on economic growth, innovation and governance reforms.

title: President AKD calls for unity as global citizens to face transnational challenges
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that global climate issues are knocking on everyone’s doors, regardless of wealth or status, and emphasized the need for global citizens to unite in addressing transnational challenges.

title: Legal Officers’ Association defends AG amidst controversy
byline: The Legal Officers’ Association of the Attorney General’s Department claims that several statements being circulated relating to an advice made by the Attorney General dated 27 January 2025, are “factually incorrect and misleading”.
